title: Several injured after utility explosions at shopping...
text:
Four people were injured after electrical vault exploded Saturday night at a restaurant in the Los Angeles suburb of Huntington Beach.

Among those injured at the Old World Village complex were were two diners and two firefighters.

All four were treated for injuries described as minor, according to Huntington Beach Fire Department officials.

But authorities also said that several people suffered burns, including one person who was taken to a local hospital in critical condition.

Among those who were injured by the explosions about 8.15pm at the Old World Village complex were patrons of the complex and fire personnel, fire officials said

That victim is believed to be an employee who was working one of the booths at the festival when the explosion occurred.

The source of the explosions may have been an electrical transformer, the Press-Telegram reported.

However, patrons also reported smelling gas before the incident.

While a heavy presence of fire and police personnel tended to the injured, hundreds of others attending an Oktoberfest event evacuated the area. Power was shut off to the complex.

Witness Kyle Nelson told KTLA that he heard and saw three large explosions in rapid succession coming from the festival.

Megan Houck, 26, of Long Beach, said that she saw flames come from the floor near a patio area.

The source of the explosions may have been an electrical transformer, authorities said

'It was just like one giant fireball that went up' she said in a story on the Press-Telegram website. 'And then there was a second explosion maybe 10 or 20 seconds later.'

Houck said that the flames went well above the roof of the village, possibly up to 35 to 40 feet high.

A few minutes before the first explosion, Houck said that the lights had shut off and on.

Other witnesses reported apparent electrical problems before the first blast.

Pat Brassil, 27, told the Times that he was outside one of the tent's at the Oktoberfest site waiting for his fiance and sister to return from the bathroom when he saw flames shoot out from another tent near the festival's entrance.

'It just lit up the sky,' he said. 'Everyone was going pretty crazy and screaming.'

Officials are still investigating the cause of the explosion.
description: Authorities reported multiple injuries after a series of utility pole explosions Saturday night at a shopping and dining complex in the Los Angeles suburb of Huntington Beach,
